name: Carlos

topics.topic_text: I've got some Aqua Pura, if you want it.
topics.response_text: You mean... you don't want anything for it? I don't have any caps or anything...
You've helped me so much, it seems wrong to ask, but can you spare any more water?
You mean... you don't want anything for it? I don't have any caps or anything...

topics.topic_text: What, just give it to you? Hell no.
topics.response_text: I knew it was too good to be true... there are no good souls in the Wasteland.

topics.topic_text: I insist, my friend. It's the least I can do to help.
topics.response_text: Really? Thank you. You're the first person willing to actually give me any of that.

topics.topic_text: What is this place? Some kind of city?
topics.response_text: It's Megaton. Have you been living in a hole or something? Everyone's heard of Megaton.
Oh... I guess that's understandable. Got to watch out for numero uno and all.
I've been drinking this irradiated shit and... I can't do it. I just throw it up now. I need purified water... please...{Pathetic.}

conversation.response_text: Please... I'm dying. I need water...

description:
Carlos is a 32 year-old Hispanic Male.

A weathered Hispanic man with sunken eyes and a gaunt appearance, Carlos sits slumped near the entrance to Rivet City. His clothes are tattered and stained, and his skin has taken on a sickly yellow hue from dehydration. He clutches a rusty tin cup, hoping to catch the attention of anyone passing by who might spare some clean water. The stench of irradiated water still lingers around him, a constant reminder of his desperation.

Carlos's Personality: Desperate and cynical, yet not entirely broken. Carlos retains a flicker of hope that someone will help him, but years of hardship have made him wary and guarded. He speaks in a raspy, weak voice, often trailing off mid-sentence due to fatigue.

Carlos's Backstory: Born in the ruins of a pre-Washington D.C. neighborhood, Carlos learned to survive in the harsh wasteland from a young age. He fell in with a raider gang in his late teens, participating in their raids and scavenging operations. During a particularly bold raid on a Super mutant stronghold, the tables turned, and Carlos found himself captured. He managed to escape during a moment of chaos, but not before being exposed to significant radiation and witnessing horrors that would haunt him. Making his way to Rivet City, he was denied entry due to his raider connections and past. With no other options, he has been camping outside the city, surviving on irradiated water from the Anacostia that his body can no longer tolerate.
